children.comment: Everything in Dart is an [Object].
children.name: Object

children.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all [Object]s is to return true if and
only if [:this:] and [other] are the same object.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override
the [hashCode] method as well to maintain consistency.
Returns a string representation of this object.
children.name: toString

children.comment:
[noSuchMethod] is invoked when users invoke a non-existant method
on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the
invocation are passed to [noSuchMethod] in an [Invocation].
If [noSuchMethod] returns a value, that value becomes the result of
the original invocation.

The default behavior of [noSuchMethod] is to throw a
[noSuchMethodError].
children.name: noSuchMethod

children.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the
same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality
operator [:==:]. Other than that there are no guarantees about
the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and
there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides [hashCode] it should override the
equality operator as well to maintain consistency.
children.name: hashCode

children.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.
children.name: runtimeType

children.comment:
Creates a new [Object] instance.

[Object] instances have no meaningful state, and are only useful
through their identity. An [Object] instance is equal to itself
only.
children.name: Object

children.comment:
Safely convert a value to a [String] description.

The conversion is guaranteed to not throw, so it won't use the object's
toString method.
children.name: safeToString

children.comment:
Designed to enable features in __Hop__. Should be the last method called in
`tool/hop_runner.dart`.

[runHop] calls [io.exit] which terminates the application.

If [paranoid] is `true`, [runHop] will verify the running script is
`tool/hop_runner.dart` relative to the working directory. If not, an
exception is thrown.

If [helpTaskName], defines (surprise!) the name of the help task. If `null`
no help task is added. If [helpTaskName] conflicts with an already defined
task, an exception is thrown.
children.name: runHop

children.comment: Terminates the current [Task] with a failure, explained by [message].
children.name: fail

children.comment:
Runs a [Task] with the specificed [TaskContext].

[runTask] handles a number of error cases, logs appropriate messages
to [context] and returns a corresponding [RunResult] when completed.
children.name: runTask

children.comment:
[run] exists primarily for testing [Task] implementations.

If you want to use Hop in an app, see [runHop].

If you want to run a specific [Task] in isolation, see [runTask].
children.name: run

children.comment:
This constructor exists for testing Hop.

If you're using it in another context, you might be doing something wrong.
children.name: HopConfig

children.comment: For explanations of exit codes see <http://tldp.org/LDP/abs/html/exitcodes.html>
children.name: RunResult

children.comment:
Ran successfully

Code 0
children.name: SUCCESS

children.comment:
Hop was called with bad arguments.

Code 64

See `EX_USAGE` in <http://www.retro11.de/ouxr/211bsd/usr/include/sysexits.h.html>
children.name: BAD_USAGE

children.comment:
Task was was started and failed gracefully

Code 80
children.name: FAIL

children.comment:
Task was was started, but threw an exception

Code 81
children.name: EXCEPTION

children.comment:
Task misbehaved. Returned null, used [TaskContext] incorrectly, etc.

Code 82
children.name: ERROR

children.comment:
Can only be accessed when frozen
Always sorted
children.name: taskNames

children.comment: At the moment [getSubLogger] returns [this].
children.name: getSubLogger
